newsitem.title: USA: Union Planters to merge with Magna Bancorp.
newsitem.headline: Union Planters to merge with Magna Bancorp.

text.p: Union Planters Corp said Thursday it and Magna Bancorp Inc have agreed to merge in a deal valued at approximately $323 million.

Under a merger agreement, Union Planters will exchange approximately 0.5165 common shares for each Magna common share, Union Planters said. Based on Union Planters' closing price of $45.50 on May 8, the Union Planters' shares to be swapped for each Magna share are worth $23.50 each.
Magna closed at 18-1/4, up 3/4 on Thursday.
Union Planters said the merger is tax-free for Magna shareholders and will be accounted for as a pooling of interests.
The merger is subject to approval of Magna shareholders and regulators and to normal contractual conditions, Union Planters said.
The deal is expected to be completed during the late third or early fourth quarter of 1997, it said.
Union Planters, which was founded in 1869, has $15 billion in assets and has over 430 banking offices in Tennessee, Mississipi, Missouri, Arkansas, Alabama, Louisiana and Kentucky.
Magna, with assets of $1.3 billion, is parent of Magnolia Federal Bank of Savings, which operates 62 banking locations in Mississippi and south Alabama.

Magna also operates Magna Mortgage Co, a subsidiary that has $3.1 billion in loans that will be combined with Union Planters' own mortgage loan unit, which has a loan servicing portfolio of more than $10 billion, Union Planters said.
